Authors:
Sheng-Hua Wu, Yu-Ping CHEN, Chia-Ling Wei, Yu Cheng Dai,
Dimitrios Floudas
Title:
Two new species of Phanerochaete (Basidiomycota) and
redescription of P. robusta
Abstract:
Phanerochaete bambusicola and P. incarnata, found from
subtropical Taiwan, both are presented as new species of Phanerochaete
s.s. The analysis of nuclear ribosomal sequence data from the
5.8s+nLSU+RPB1 genes with maximum parsimony and Bayesian methods,
indicated that phylogenetic placement of the three species, is in
Phanerochaete s.s. An additional analysis of the ITS region, revealed
their phylogenetic relationships among the Phanerochaete s.s. P.
bambusicola was found on dead bamboo culm, characterized in having loose
texture of subiculum, leptocystidia, and subicular hyphae sometimes bear
a short lateral branch. P. incarnata is characterized in having pink
hymenial surface, and leptocystidia usually covered with yellowish
resinous material. P. robusta distribtutes in NE Asia is re-described as
having immersed leptocystidia that are usually irregularly swollen and
with oily drops.
